glsa.title: Shoutcast Server: Remote code execution
glsa.synopsis: Shoutcast Server contains a possible buffer overflow that could lead to the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Shoutcast Server is Nullsoft's streaming audio server. It runs on a variety of platforms, including Linux, and is extremely popular with Internet broadcasters.

description.p: Part of the Shoutcast Server Linux binary has been found to improperly handle sprintf() parsing.

impact.p: A malicious attacker could send a formatted URL request to the Shoutcast Server. This formatted URL would cause either the server process to crash, or the execution of arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
